title.narrative: OIE (World Organization for Animal Health) Twinning Project

description.narrative: China Twinning, USDA CEAH/CAHEC implemented three activities , In FY 2012, three activities took place in accordance with the plan between agreed to by USDA, China and the OIE: first, a combined training on qualitative and quantitative risk assessment occurred in February 2012, second, CAHEC trainers will assist CEAH in implementing the APHIS Introduction to Risk Analysis for Animal Health course in May 2012, third, initiate planning to provide training on spatial epidemiology and begin collaborative work on a risk assessment that CAHEC selects. Note that partial costs are reimbursed through a cooperative agreement with the OIE

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: Wildlife Disease Surveillance in China is underway with work conducted by collaborators. WS collaborated with the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the Chinese State Forest Administration to sponsor a regional wildlife disease symposium in Suzhou, China on July 6, 2012. WS and CAS conducted a wildlife disease training activity for SFA staff in USA during September. WS participated in the wildlife disease symposium in Suzhou, China. WS met with China CDC to discuss areas for potential collaboration. The work is being directed by collaborators at CSU. Graduate students from Bogor University are completing their findings of surveillance activities for avian influenza in live-bird markets.

description.narrative: The course was designed to enhance technical capacity of personnel to be able to provide reference services in disease investigation and disease management strategies specifically for the current African swine fever outbreaks. Through this project, instructors assessed training needs for the China Animal Health and Epidemiology Center to provide field services in China and neighboring countries to control the spread of ASF.
